documents.title: oundle crash death man named
text: a man who died following a collision in oundle , northamptonshire has been named as 23-year-old stuart randall .
mr randall , from bourne in lincolnshire , died following the crash on monday , 2 april .

the incident took place on the a605 when the silver ford fiesta driven by mr randall , which was travelling north , collided with a silver renault scenic and a grey honda crv travelling in the opposite direction .
five occupants of the honda crv were taken to peterborough hospital with serious injuries .
the two occupants of the renault scenic were not injured .
author: Craig Lewis
BBC Online East

documents.title: st edmunds retirement village work to start
text: work to redevelop the old st edmunds hospital site in northampton is set to get under way .
the current building has stood empty for 20 years and has changed ownership several times .
rochmills group , which took ownership of the wellingborough road-based listed building in 2016 , says it will be converted into a 130 apartment retirement village and a 62-bed specialist care home .
it is expected the work will take two years to complete .
councillor tim hadland said it was terrific news , adding : `` making the area look more alive is bound to be good . ''
author: Craig Lewis
BBC Online East

documents.title: county athletes set for 2018 commonwealth games
text: three athletes from northamptonshire will be among more than 4,500 from 71 nations and territories competing at the 2018 commonwealth games , which begin on australia 's gold coast today .
swimmer ellie robinson , 16 , from northampton - a gold medal winner at rio 2016 - will compete in the s7 50m butterfly on thursday .

also representing the county are england basketball player shane walker , 30 , from northampton and 18-year-old kieran rollings from kettering , who is the youngest member of the english lawn bowls team .

the opening ceremony for the 21st commonwealth games takes place at the carrara stadium from 10:00 this morning , and the first gold medal will be contested in the women 's triathlon at 00:31 on thursday .

i 'll be joined by cobblers ' commentator tim oglethorpe for a phone-in to discuss the situation at sixfields .

documents.title: jimmy floyd hasselbaink sacked : who will take over ?
text: it 's the morning after the night before for northampton town fans , with jimmy floyd hasselbaink sacked as the club 's manager after nine games without a win .

the league one side face a struggle to avoid relegation , and easter monday 's 2-0 defeat at local rivals peterborough proved the final straw , with the cobblers 22nd in the table , two points from safety , and having played more games than their rivals .

dean austin , hasselbaink 's assistant , and jon brady - the former brackley town boss - have been placed in charge until the end of the season , but that has n't stopped the bookmakers getting to work .
one market has ex-scunthorpe manager graham alexander as favourite , while caretaker austin is also listed alongside the likes of uwe rosler and steve cotterill .

the incident happened at 18:06 yesterday on the a605 at oundle when a silver ford fiesta , travelling north , was in collision with a silver renault scenic and a grey honda crv travelling in the opposite direction .
the driver of the ford fiesta was declared dead at the scene .
five occupants of the honda crv were taken to peterborough hospital with serious injuries , one potentially life-threatening .
the two occupants of the renault scenic were not injured .

documents.title: we like big boats and we can not lie
text: `` it 's not what we usually do `` say road policing officers as they prepare to escort a rather big boat across parts of east anglia .
this one 's going from oundle in northamptonshire , along the a605 south to the a1 at st neots in cambridgeshire , then through cambridge city centre before heading for the suffolk coast .
it 's the `` most convenient route avoiding high bridges and tight bends '' , officers from the bedfordshire , cambridgeshire and hertfordshire road police unit say .
the officers accompanying the boat are volunteering for the task on their days off , and the cost of the trip is not funded by the `` public purse '' , they 're keen to point out .
they probably just like big boats

and if that 's the case , it 's their last chance to escort one this size as the manufacturer - fairline yachts - is moving part of its business to a new facility in hythe , southampton water , where its larger vessels will be built in the future .
a slightly different job for the road policing unit today , ensuring the safe escort of this yacht through the county on its journey to suffolk .
what 's the route will try to avoid nothing personal mind
a605 to a1 , south to st neots , across to cambridge and through the city centre .
the most convenient route avoiding high bridges and tight bends .
have fun .
do n't go through a drive thru .
i ca n't help but feel this is not the best use of resources
the officers are working their rest day , the funding does not come from the public purse .
no arguments here then !
nice boat !
last 78 foot yacht built by @ twitterid leaves # oundle .
larger models will in future be built at new site in # southampton more @ twitterid @ twitterid
after watching look east i really would n't want to follow that ship by road .
awesome as it is .
yes our cameraman actually got stuck on his way to the next job !

documents.title: time to 'look to the future'northamptonshire county council statement
text: a northamptonshire conservative peter bone says it is now important to `` look to the future '' , adding that any new structure must be driven locally .
he also wonders whether the cabinet and committee system was one cause of the council 's problems .
mr javid agrees that any reorganisation must be `` locally led '' .
as for the cabinet system , he says it is an issue that any review will examine carefully .
author: House of Commons
Parliament

documents.title: sajid javid accuses labour of 'political football ' over northamptonshirenorthamptonshire county council statement
text: sajid javid accuses labour of not listening to his statement and wanting to play `` political football '' .
`` if he 'd read the report he 'd see it 's crystal clear there is not an issue of lack of funds , '' he says .
he specifies that if commissioners are sent in it will be by the end of april , and he does not intend to give more resources to northamptonshire as this would be `` rewarding mismanagement '' .
author: House of Commons
Parliament

documents.title: inspector report makes for 'very sorry reading'northamptonshire county council statement
text: shadow housing , communities and local government secretary andrew gwynne says the council inspection report makes for `` very sorry reading '' and is an `` indictment '' of mismanagement locally and eight years of austerity nationally .
he recalls that in 2015 , the local government association said that spending reserves to provide services was not the right thing to do .
he says the council was cutting the ribbon on a new £ 53m office building as it was preparing to announce itself bankrupt .
mr gwynne says the national audit office has said that one in 10 councils with social care obligations will have exhausted their reserves in the next three years .
he asks what contingency plans the government has for other councils in danger of facing the same problems .
he adds that redrawing the boundaries of the council area , as proposed , would not solve the underlying issues the council faces .
`` northamptonshire is the first , but will not be the last , '' he states .
author: House of Commons
Parliament

documents.title: northamptonshire county council failings not due to lack of funding - javidnorthamptonshire county council
text: housing , communities and local government secretary sajid javid says that the situation in northamptonshire is `` concerning '' .
auditors at the council had previously signalled that the authority was not managing its services effectively , he states .
and these concerns prompted him to act , he adds .
mr javid commissioned a report on january 9th and the final report was submitted on 15th march .
mr javid says that the inspector has identified `` multiple apparent failures '' in complying with their `` best value '' duties .
he says the inspection concludes it is `` not down to a lack of funding '' but identifies difficulties wiht oversight and `` blurred '' accountability .
the council did not respond well to either external or internal criticism , mr javid says , he adds that the `` hardworking staff '' at the council are not at fault .
the problems are `` so deep and ingrained '' that it would not be feasible to try and fix them , he states .
he is `` minded '' to take control over the council to `` stabilise '' the authority .
author: House of Commons
Parliament

documents.title: cctv images released after robbery at northampton store
text: cctv images of two masked men police want to speak after a robbery in a store in stanley street , semilong , northampton , have been released .
two men , one holding a large handgun , entered a convenience store wearing face coverings and gloves between 21:10 and 21:20 on saturday .
they made threats with the handgun to staff inside the store before stealing cash , cigarettes and alcohol .
the men in the or anyone who recognises them are asked to call northamptonshire police .

documents.title: new cabinet at troubled northamptonshire county council
text: a fresh cabinet team has been named to take under-pressure northamptonshire county council `` into a new period of transformation '' .

the changes come in the aftermath of a damning government report which recommended the authority should be scrapped with two new unitary authorities created to replace the county and district councils by 2020 .

the county council , which recently approved £ 40m worth of cuts for 2018/19 , could be taken over by government commissioners if the report 's recommendations are taken up by secretary of state for local government , sajid javid .
heather smith , leader of the conservative-controlled authority , resigned following the publication of the report , while finance cabinet member robin brown was sacked .
matthew golby ( who is currently acting leader , is expected to be confirmed as council leader next month .
his new deputy will be cecile irving-swift , who has no previous front bench experience .
she will also serve as cabinet member for public health , while michael clarke , who has previously served as member for highways , returns to the cabinet to take over the finance brief .
mr golby said his team `` combines some experienced cabinet members with some new talent '' .
author: Craig Lewis
BBC Online East

documents.title: brackley town to play at wembley stadium
text: brackley town have reached a wembley cup final for the first time in their 128-year history .
the national league north side beat wealdstone 2-0 on saturday in the second leg of their fa trophy semi-final to win 3-0 on aggregate .
they will face bromley from the division above them in the final on 20 may .
it also means a second attempt at winning the final for brackley manager kevin wilkin , who was a beaten finalist with old club wrexham in 2015 - who sacked him the following day .

documents.title: work starts at derelict northampton hospital and workhouse
text: some building work has started on the former st edmund 's hospital in northampton .
the victorian building has been in a poor state for years and there are plans to build a new care village on the site and renovate the listed building at the front .
when the plans were unveiled in 2015 , developers said much of the building , designed by architect george gilbert scott , would be retained .
the hospital and former workhouse was closed in 1998 and has since become a target for vandalism .

documents.title: film crews come to daventry for latest nativity movie
text: daventry is to appear in the next film in the nativity series of movies .
a film crew spent the day in the main shopping area recording scenes for nativity rocks !
- the fourth in the series .
director debbie isitt said shopkeepers and shoppers in the town coped well with the demands of filming and were `` absolutely amazing '' .
she added : `` it [ daventry ] has a lovely community feel to the whole place .
we 'll definitely come back and film again . ''
the movie is due out in late november - just in time for christmas .

it happened as the silver peugeot 107 was travelling eastbound at about 23:15 on tuesday on the b4525 near the junction of thorpe road .
northamptonshire police said it crashed for `` unknown reasons '' .

documents.title: northamptonshire county council 's tories : 'we 're sorry '
text: conservatives at under-pressure northamptonshire county council have offered a public apology to the people of the county .
it comes after a highly critical report said the authority should be scrapped .
council leader heather smith ( resigned in the wake of the report , while finance member robin brown was sacked .

in a statement , the authority 's acting leader , matt golby , said the tory group `` has moved swiftly to take on board the criticisms '' made in the report and are determined to `` lead the recovery process '' .
he added a fresh leadership team will soon be revealed , including `` new and currently untapped talent combined with the valued experience we have available '' .

documents.title: council review £ 5m loan to neighbouring authority
text: the leader of leicestershire county council has reassured taxpayers it will get its £ 5m loan back from northamptonshire county council .
the authority lent its neighbours the money but now northamptonshire county council is facing allegations of financial mismanagement .
a report last week recommended it should be abolished and replaced with two unitary authorities .
so what does this mean for the money leicestershire lent them ?
well , byron rhodes has told the bbc : `` i appreciate that there is some disquiet and we 've taken action to carefully review the loan .
`` our professional view is that despite northamptonshire county council 's situation , there is no realistic prospect of the loan not being paid back . ''

BBC News

documents.title: tory mp congratulates 18 labour mps over russia motionbusiness statement
text: conservative mp peter bone congratulates 18 labour mps who have signed an early day motion in support of theresa may 's decision to expel twenty three russian diplomats , following the poisoning of a spy and his daughter in salisbury .
the move appears to be a snub to labour leader jeremy corbyn , who has questioned whether the nerve agent attack was the work of president putin 's regime .

the motion was tabled by john woodcock , an opponent of mr corbyn , and `` unequivocally '' accepts the `` russian state 's culpability '' for the attack , and says it would consider supporting `` further proportionate action to deter future acts of aggression by the russian state '' .
author: House of Commons
Parliament

documents.title: parents fined £ 24m for children 's truancy and term time holidays
text: parents across england and wales have been fined about £ 24m for failing to send their children to school during the past three years , it has emerged .
a bbc investigation also shows some councils are issuing penalties at rates five times higher than the average .
here are the figures for the strictest authorities in the east of england and the numbers of fines in the past three full academic years .
suffolk county council has come out top in both cases .

documents.title: northampton theatre given £ 684k to produce new shows
text: northampton 's royal & derngate theatre has been awarded £ 684,000 to create four original musicals , a festival to showcase new productions and to support new writers and composers .
the money from arts council england will be used to produce new shows suitable for touring at medium-sized venues across the country .
james dacre , artistic director at royal & derngate , said : `` we shall support at least 150 artists to create a diverse range of truly original new work .
these are exciting times . ''

peter knott , from arts council england , said : `` the financial and funding context in northamptonshire is challenging for arts companies like the royal & derngate , so it 's great to see such ambition and enthusiasm which will bring interesting and diverse theatre to new audiences . ''

the 19-year-old man has been charged with possession of a class a substance with intent to supply , production of cannabis and possession of false documents .

documents.title: anti-fracking protesters guilty of obstructing highway
text: two people have been found guilty of obstructing the highway in the first trial of anti fracking protesters in north yorkshire .

york magistrates ' court heard how last october , 40-year-old julia collings of row road , northampton and 52-year-old ronald holloran , of suddaby close , hull , sat on top of the wooden tower on a road near the proposed fracking site in kirby misperton .
they refused to come down in a stand-off with the police .
they 've both been sentenced to a six-month conditional discharge , and each ordered to pay costs of £ 220 .

documents.title: people in daventry warned to 'avoid ' smoke from fire
text: northamptonshire fire and rescue service has warned people in daventry to `` avoid '' smoke from a warehouse , which is still smouldering after a large fire on sunday night .
a spokesman said : `` while the smoke is not toxic , residents are advised to keep it out of their homes by keeping doors and windows closed .
`` they are also advised not to expose themselves to the smoke unnecessarily and not to breathe it in . ''
more than 50 firefighters were called to the building in parsons road , which is owned by garden centre suppliers gardman , and the roof appears to have collapsed .
a man has been arrested on sus of arson .

documents.title: wooley mammoth tusk to be auctioned in northamptonshire
text: an `` extraordinarily rare '' 10,000-year-old woolly mammoth tusk is to be sold at auction in northamptonshire .
the 220cm ( 86.5in ) -long item , which is exempt from the ivory ban because it is from an extinct species , is said to have been discovered in siberia in the 19th century and carved in china .
it was purchased by a private buyer in new york in 2009 and is estimated to sell for up to £ 40,000 at humbert and ellis auctioneers of whittlebury near towcester on 5 april .
auctioneer jonathan humbert said : `` this really is a thing of utter beauty and we anticipate much global interest in this very statemental piece . ''

documents.title: raped woman married-off for money and visa , court told
text: a woman who suffered a head injury when she was raped was married-off by her father for money , a court heard .
the marriage also took place to improve her husband 's immigration status , london 's court of protection heard .
mr justice baker decided the islamic marriage was `` arranged entirely '' by the man and the woman 's father .
he said the marriage took place at northampton islamic centre when the woman was vulnerable to influence and ruled it was invalid under english law .
the woman , who can not be identified , has links to london and northampton .

documents.title: cupid cop gets colourful with pen present
text: a kindly northamptonshire copper who last month made a st valentine 's day card for an elderly man to give to his wife - because he could not afford to buy one - has been rewarded for his community spirit .

pcso andy emberton played cupid to the 74-year-old man by getting him a cup of tea at the force 's northampton community hub , and drawing a valentine 's card for the man to sign and take to his wife .
at the time , pcso emberton said he wished he had more pens at the hub so he could have made the card more colourful and guess what happened next ?
yes , a member of the public read about his good deed and sent money for him to buy some coloured pens .
`` this really shows the power of social media and was such a lovely gesture , '' says pcso emberton .
`` since valentine 's day , i have seen the elderly gentleman who said that his wife was absolutely over the moon with her card . ''

documents.title: northamptonshire county council loaned £ 10m by oxon
text: northamptonshire county council has borrowed another £ 10m from a neighbouring authority - the second council to confirm it loaned cash to the bankrupt local authority , the bbc has learned .
it emerged on wednesday that leicestershire county council loaned the council £ 5m in january .
and now oxfordshire county council has said it gave £ 5m in october and £ 5m in december .
northamptonshire county council has been forced to impose a spending ban on itself to balance the books for its 2016-17 budget .
it has also just approved £ 40m worth of cuts for next year .

councils can not borrow money to run everyday services , but northamptonshire county council says the loan is for `` cash-flow purposes '' and that it is `` normal practice '' for local authorities to lend each other money .
the oxfordshire loans are due to be repaid in july and september , and the leicestershire loan in january 2019 .

documents.title: consultation dates for rail central freight terminal
text: a second round of consultations on a giant strategic rail freight terminal in the south of northamptonshire is set to get under way .
the rail central scheme was first proposed in early 2016 , and a first set of consultation events took place that year .
the proposals would see developer ashfield land build an eight million square foot ( 743,200 square metre ) freight hub linking rail and road routes on land between blisworth and milton malsor .
it would include warehouses , a lorry park and a service depot .

the new consultations feature changes to the original plans including replacing a proposed roundabout with an underpass , restricting vehicle movements at the site 's junction with towcester road to emergency vehicles only , and introducing parkland close to the a43 .
details for highways works will also be published including proposals for substantial changes at j15a of the m1 .
the fresh dates are :
author: Craig Lewis
BBC East

documents.title: domestic abuse refuge for men opens in northampton
text: the first refuge centre for male victims of domestic abuse in northamptonshire has opened .
it will be one of only nine centres in the uk to cater exclusively for men and will accept referrals from all over the country .
it is estimated that 450,000 men are victims of domestic abuse every year and figures from northamptonshire police show that a quarter of all reports of domestic abuse in 2015 came from men .
yesterday , the first refuge of its kind in the county opened - a house , consisting of three rooms , exclusively for men , which can accommodate children too .
the refuge will be a place where male victims can seek help and support , whilst they are found somewhere more permanent if required .
author: Anna Bartlett
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: it 's not only the weather conditions our paramedics are battling
text: it 's thieves too .

east midlands ambulance service says a satellite navigation system and a mobile data terminal screen , used to send information to clinicians about the location and condition of patients , were both stolen from an ambulance parked outside a home in corby in the early hours .
the crew returned to the ambulance to take the patient to hospital only to find all the cupboards in the ambulance open and the electrical equipment missing .

lee brentnall , ambulance operations manager for northamptonshire , said : `` this senseless act means that the ambulance had to be taken off the road to have the equipment replaced , and ca n't respond to emergencies .
whoever did this clearly did n't think of the impact that their actions would have on their community .
`` while every effort has been made to replace the equipment as soon as possible , the incident will have an obvious impact on our ability to respond to patients .
`` i would urge anyone who saw anything sus or knows who could be responsible , to please call on 101 and quote incident 1800009472 . ''

this is our county '' he says , referring to the younger generation .

says it is clear there will need to be further reductions in spend '' more cuts .
heather smith is interrupted by a man in public gallery , when she resumes she pleads for people to give officers time to come up with new plans .
says they will work through the weekend .
opposition councillors talking about how money from asset sales are used .
the rules about how this money is used to balance the books is crucial to kpmgs warning this week .
the money has to be used on transformation '' which is turning into word of the week .

documents.title: northants 'no new spending ' rule to remain until april
text: the section 114 notice imposed on northamptonshire county council by its own chief financial officer will remain in place until at least the end of the current financial year .
councillors today agreed to accept mark mclaughlin 's report on the notice , which prevents all new spending , except on statutory services .
conservative council leader heather smith has said savings already made as a result of the notice had been `` insufficient '' and that it needed to remain in place .

the labour opposition leader , bob scott , asked how councillors could set a budget for next year when there is n't a balanced budget for this year , while the liberal democrats ' chris stanbra questioned how much money had been saved already by the notice .
today 's council meeting had been expected to set a budget for 2018-19 , but that has been delayed on the advice of the local authority 's auditors .
author: Craig Lewis
BBC Northampton

documents.title: northamptonshire county council budget 's 'serious ' consequences
text: the consequences of ignoring an advisory note from auditors kpmg are `` unpredictable '' , but would be `` serious for all of us '' .
those were the words of northamptonshire county council 's chief finance officer mark mclaughlin at this morning 's full council meeting , where it was due to set its £ 435.54m budget for 2018-19 .
that has been delayed after kpmg issued the advisory note on tuesday evening .
mr mclaughlin said the advisory note will not `` stop the democratic process '' , but added that the authority must now produce a `` robust and realistic '' budget .
he also discussed the s114 notice he himself issued earlier this year which prevents all new spending at the council .

mr mclaughlin said the financial situation at the council , where he projected a £ 21.1m overspend for 2017-18 , is `` the worst in england '' and the worst he has seen in 30 years of working in local government .
author: Craig Lewis
BBC Northampton

he said the show is `` about the town i was raised in '' and was inspired by his 1991 album the soul cages .
it tells the story of a community during the demise of the shipbuilding industry in tyne and wear .
sting said : `` i was born within spitting distance of a shipyard where they built the biggest ships in the world .
`` the whole town was very proud of that fact and the shipyard closed down so the town was mortally wounded in a way . ''

documents.title: tory jason smithers wins higham ferrers by-election
text: conservative jason smithers won yesterday 's higham ferrers by-election to became part of the `` worst run '' council in the country .
kettering mp philip hollobone gave that description to northamptonshire county council after the authority was hit with a notice banning all new expenditure .

one of mr smithers ' first decisions will be whether to back his under fire leader heather smith - a statement signed by 21 of his new backbench colleagues recently called for the council to be run by government commissioners .
mr smithers polled 1,414 of the 2,503 votes cast , with labour 's gary day finishing second with 557 votes .
the turnout was 26.04 % .
the seat was left vacant following the death of glenn harwood in november .
author: Craig Lewis
BBC Online East

documents.title: no chickens allowed in house of commons , mp warned
text: an mp who has been campaigning against a massive chicken farm in northamptonshire has been warned he can not bring chickens in to the house of commons in order to make his point .
conservative peter bone - who represents wellingborough - is opposed to plans for the poultry farm in rushden .
speaking in the commons last week , mr bone said : `` there is an application to have 540,000 [ chickens ] slaughtered every 42 days .
that is unacceptable .
`` would you allow me , sir , to bring in a cage with the chickens in it to demonstrate the appalling conditions they have to live under ? ''
however , the speaker , john bercow , was having none of it .
`` no cage , no chickens - at any rate in the chamber , '' he replied .

documents.title: wadebridge sculptor creates statue of suffragette mp
text: a cornish sculptor has created a statue of a prominent suffragette on the 100th anniversary of women first being given the right to vote in the uk .

richard austin from wadebridge was commissioned by northampton borough council to design a 7ft ( 2m ) sculpture of margaret bondfield , a labour mp for northampton who became the first female cabinet member as well as co-founding the first trade union for women .
mr austin says it is a great way to mark such an important figure .
`` northampton borough council has been amazing , '' she said .
`` it 's unprecedented in commissioning a sculptor to create seven life-size sculptures of important people from northampton .
she 's the final one .
`` it 's fantastic that she 's such an important lady from northampton and especially in this year of 100 years of women getting the vote . ''
the sculpture joins six other famous northampton figures commissioned by the council - francis crick , lady wantage , edgar mobbs , walter tull , john clare and malcolm arnold .
margaret bondfield 's statue will be unveiled at northampton guildhall on 20 march .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

text: shadow housing secretary andrew gwynne claims the situation in northamptonshire is a result of a `` perfect storm of chronic underfunding and catastrophic tory mismanagement '' , adding : `` you just can not push the cost of council services onto local taxpayers . ''
rishi sunak says `` the secretary of state took action on northamptonshire - it is exactly what responsible government looks like '' .

Parliament

documents.title: mp : send commissioners into northamptonshire councilurgent question
text: mr hollobone describes northamptonshire county council as `` the worst-run local authority in the country '' and its problems as having been `` exacerbated by poor leadership '' .
he says he and fellow northamptonshire mps have no confidence in the council and `` the sooner commissioners are sent in to sort out this mess the better '' .
the minister responds that the inspection now taking place is independent but his department is open to any representations from the council .
author: House of Commons
Parliament

documents.title: 'it is for northamptonshire to decide ' how to manage its budgeturgent question
text: housing , communities and local government minister rishi sunak is answering an urgent question from conservative philip hollobone , mp for kettering , on northamptonshire county council .
the council has brought in a `` section 114 '' notice , banning new expenditure .
despite this , legal obligations have seen it issue a budget for 2018/19 to allow a council tax precept to be set .
mr sunak stresses the notice does not `` automatically '' mean services will stop and `` it is for the council to decide '' how it meets budgetary pressures .
author: House of Commons
Parliament

documents.title: corby urgent care centre plans to be scrutinised
text: the future of corby 's urgent care centre will be discussed at a public meeting at the cube this evening .
about 70,000 people a year have been getting healthcare by turning up at the centre on cottingham road , but under new plans they would have to book a same-day appointment by calling their gp first .
the nhs corby clinical commissioning group said the new system would help direct patients to the right part of the nhs for treatment and reduce a & e attendances at kettering general hospital .
a public consultation will begin next month and , if approved , the changes will be implemented in april .

documents.title: hello - is this what you 've been waiting for ?
text: fans of lionel richie will be `` dancing on the ceiling '' to hear the us singer-songwriter is hitting the road in june for a string of gigs .
and he 's kicking it off in northampton !

his franklin 's gardens gig on 1 june will be the first of a string of dates including stops in perth , hove , lincoln , shrewsbury , leigh , carlisle , scarborough , chesterfield and london , where richie will play at hampton court palace festival .
the singer , famous for hits such as hello and dancing on the ceiling , said he was looking forward to seeing `` parts of the country i 've never made it out to before '' .

richie will no doubt be welcomed and embraced by the good people of northamptonshire , and perhaps when he returns to the us he 'll speak well of it to other stars such as hollywood actress lindsay lohan , who sort of promised to turn on the christmas lights in kettering , but did n't quite manage it .

documents.title: couple campaign for nhs tests for baby-killing bacteria
text: a couple from desborough have set up a campaign calling on the nhs to provide expectant mums with a £ 35 test for a potentially-fatal bacteria in unborn babies .
group b streptococcus is carried by one-in-four women and can infect a baby 's lungs , blood and brain , though only about one-in-2,000 newborns falls ill because of it .
amanda osbourne and jason barnes 's daughter mia died from the bacteria four years ago , and they believe she would have survived if they had been given more information about it .
mr barnes said : `` it 's very clear the uk does have a problem in awareness of infections such as group b strep .
`` a pregnant lady is not screened for the infection as part of her routine anti-natal care and that 's something we believe needs to change . ''

his family said `` we believe that there are people in coventry and possibly in northampton who may know where the main suspect is .
`` we know we have lost jon but what makes it even harder for us all is the fact that the person who did this to him , and to us as a family , is still out there getting on with his life . ''

documents.title: breakingdouble murder : redruth man arrested
text: a 31-year old redruth man has been arrested on sus of double murder and fraud after a man and a woman were found dead , more than a year-and-a-half apart in a buckinghamshire village , police say .
peter farquhar , 69 , died in maids moreton near buckingham , on october 26 2015 , and ann moore-martin , 83 , died on may 12 2017 , thames valley police said .
their cause of their deaths is `` undetermined '' .

the redruth man , who has not been named , was arrested on sus of two counts of murder , two counts of conspiracy to murder , two counts of sus of fraud by false representation , one count of conspiracy to defraud and one count of burglary .
a 27-year-old man from towcester , northamptonshire , and a 22-year-old man from milton keynes have also been arrested in connection with the inquiry .
officers said a property near redruth was being searched on tuesday morning along with three others in different locations in england .
author: Amy Gladwell
BBC News Online

documents.title: flats plan for former rothwell factory to go before councillors
text: a plan to turn a factory in rothwell into flats has faced criticism , despite council officers recommending it for approval .
the mainly red brick old factory is between rushton road and glendon road , near the blue bell pub in the town 's conservation area .
it is proposed that the main buildings are turned into 26 one and two-bedroom flats .

but rothwell town council and some residents have raised objections including lack of parking , noise concerns and not enough space at local schools and doctors for the people who would be living there .
kettering borough council 's planning committee is due to decide on planning permission tonight , with a recommendation to approve the development .
author: Martin Borley
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: protests and legal action planned over at-risk libraries
text: a campaign group trying to save oundle library has arranged a `` sit-in '' protest at the building this afternoon , inviting people to `` peacefully demonstrate '' against its possible closure .
a similar event has been organised at brackley library , while the save desborough library campaign group has instructed lawyers to consider legal action to keep the facility open .
northamptonshire county council announced in october that some libraries could be community-run while some smaller ones could close as part of proposals to make £ 10m of cuts .
a council spokesman said : `` due to the authority 's significant funding pressures , we have no option but to consult on a proposed review of the current model for northamptonshire libraries .
a consultation on the future of the county 's libraries runs until tomorrow and a decision will be made on 22 february .

documents.title: thousands sign petition against respite break cuts
text: more than 10,000 people have signed a petition against cuts to a northamptonshire service which offers short respite breaks for children with disabilities or learning difficulties .

northamptonshire county council says it will continue to spend around £ 2m a year on the council-run service , but it is planning to stop a recent £ 1m overspend which happened when the nene & corby clinical commissioning groups ( ccg ) withdrew some funding .
the petition was set up by labour 's sally keeble , who was the mp for northampton north between 1997 and 2010 .

`` with that money being removed by the ccgs , there has got to be some loss somewhere , '' said paul meadows from the northants parents forum group , which represents families where children have disabilities or special education needs .
`` we do n't know how this is going to end up , or what it 's going to mean . ''

`` we have some fresh faces , and what the prime minister was setting out to achieve was to improve the pipeline of newer younger members of parliament who are incredibly diverse . ''

documents.title: northants police stop car after herts burglaries
text: police officers in northampton stopped a silver ford mondeo in shadowfax drive on wednesday afternoon following a police pursuit in connection with four burglaries and two kidnaps that are reported to have occurred in hertfordshire earlier in the day .
the car was stopped at about 14:00 .
the reported burglaries were in little acres in ware , saffron close in hoddesdon , london road in hertford heath and mercia road in baldock .
the offenders damaged a police car as officers arrived at the scene of the hoddesdon burglary .
a man was taken against his will at the scene of the baldock burglary when his vehicle was stolen and a woman was held in welwyn when her vehicle was stolen .
both are safe and were not injured during the incident .
a 50-year-old man from essex was arrested by northamptonshire police.two other men made off from the scene and inquiries are ongoing to locate them .
as part of the investigation , a grey bmw was recovered in mercia road , baldock and a blue honda civic was recovered in fulling mill lane , welwyn .

documents.title: northampton general 's one-hour parking rate one of most expensive
text: the hourly parking rate at northampton general hospital is one of the most expensive in the country , according to figures released this morning .
it costs £ 3.20 an hour to park at ngh - putting it fourth behind the royal surrey in guildford ( £ 4 ) hereford county ( £ 3.50 ) and bristol royal infirmary , at £ 3.40 an hour .

northampton general was one of 111 out of 120 nhs trusts across england to respond to a freedom of information request from the press association , which found that nhs hospitals made a record £ 174m in the last year from charging patients , visitors and staff for car parking .
a department of health spokesman said : `` patients and families should not have to deal with the added stress of complex and unfair parking charges .
`` nhs organisations are locally responsible for the methods used to charge , and we want to see them coming up with flexible options that put patients and their families first . ''
author: Orla Moore
BBC Local Live

documents.title: borough council budget moots parking charge increase
text: northampton borough council 's cabinet has met to discuss plans for next year 's budget .
the budget-setting proposal at the borough council comes against a backdrop of a funding gap of more than £ 11m over the next five years .
the deficit is the result of years of reductions in government funding .
plans to address this included proposals to increase car parking fees in northampton by £ 1 per day along with the introduction of an additional £ 2 charge at the weekend .
a council tax increase of more than two per cent was also discussed .

documents.title: corby police station closes , replaced by new desk at corby cube
text: corby police station has shut down , but has been replaced by a police desk situated at corby cube .

the county 's force says it is more modern and welcoming .
`` there 's no doubt the footfall within front offices has dropped significantly , '' said insp julie mead from northamptonshire police .
`` but we are hoping that people will see us here and use this as an opportunity to speak to the police . ''
the cube - which is also home to corby borough council and a theatre - is about half a mile from the now closed police station on elizabeth street .

documents.title: shops 'will switch ' if booker raises prices
text: the competition and markets authority ( cma ) says it also examined whether tesco 's £ 3.7bn takeover of booker `` could raise prices or reduce service quality at either the wholesale or retail levels '' .
it concluded `` that existing strong competition in wholesale and retail made this unlikely '' .
the cma said that of the hundreds of retailers it surveyed during its investigation into the deal , `` most shops use more than one wholesaler and frequently switch '' .

they added : `` in addition , almost half of symbol group retailers surveyed and more than a third of independent retailers said that if booker were to raise prices after the merger with tesco , they might stop buying from booker altogether . ''

documents.title: watchdog clears tesco-booker deal
text: the competition and markets authority ( cma ) has cleared hertfordshire-based tesco 's takeover of northamptonshire wholesaler booker .
the cma says : `` tesco , as a retailer , and booker , as a wholesaler , do not compete head-to-head in most of their activities . ''
booker supplies shops operating under the premier , londis and budgens brands .
but the cma added : `` booker does not own the shops it supplies and these retailers are free to set their prices and decide which products to stock .
so , although these shops compete with tesco , booker can not directly determine how they compete . ''

documents.title: council tax bills to rise by as much as £ 100
text: the government has given local councils and police permission to increase council tax next year by as much as 6 % .

we are still waiting for the details to come through , and councils and police and crime commissioners ( pccs ) will have to make the final decision , but it is very possible that many people in the region will be paying an extra £ 100 next year .
local government secretary sajid javid told mps he 'd allow councils to increase council tax by an extra 1 % next year without the need to hold a referendum .
he also said pccs would be able to charge an extra £ 12 a year for policing .
at the moment they can only increase bills by 2 % , which is about £ 4 a year .
many of our councils and local police forces have complained about funding pressures and called for the flexibility to increase council tax .
now the government has given them permission to do so , although mr javid warned them `` voters will be watching to make sure this new freedom is not abused '' .
author: Andrew Sinclair
BBC Look East political correspondent

documents.title: driver dies after crashing with three other vehicles
text: an 82-year-old man has died following a road crash in northampton last thursday .
the man was driving a ford s-max along the a428 harlestone road towards harlestone , near the wyevale garden centre and harlestone firs , at 16:40 when it crossed into the opposite carriageway .
it collided with three other vehicles before leaving the road and continuing through the hedgerow , coming to rest in the ditch , police said .
the driver was taken to northampton general hospital where he died .
officers investigating the collision would like to speak to anyone who may have witnessed it or who may have any information about what happened .

documents.title: university probes uk child deaths from sepsis
text: health experts are to investigate why the uk has more childhood deaths from treatable infections than comparable european countries .
the research will examine concerns raised by melissa mead from cornwall and sue morrish from devon , who both lost young sons to sepsis after high profile failures in the health system .

sweden and italy both have better survival rates from conditions such as pneumonia and sepsis , and the study will look at why delays in hospitalisations for these conditions - which often turn out to be fatal - occur .
the hope is the project will identify ways to speed up admissions and ultimately save lives , the university of northampton , which is leading the project , said .

documents.title: crash driver sentenced for second time after one victim dies
text: a driver who caused a crash eight years ago has been sentenced for a second time after one of the victims died .
michael mattacola , then 25 , lost control of his bmw car in heavy rain on the a45 london road in northampton in 2009 .
it veered into the path of a car carrying married couple dawn and norman chandler , who were injured and had to be cut free .
he was found guilty of careless driving and fined £ 700 .
but mrs chandler 's health deteriorated as a direct result of injuries caused by the crash and she died in 2016 , aged 71 .
mattacola pleaded guilty at northampton crown court to a fresh charge of causing death by careless driving .
he was given a 12-month suspended prison sentence , ordered to do 200 hours ' community service and banned from driving for a year .
author: Elinor Cross
BBC Radio Northampton

text: it 's time for another inevitable cute animal-in-the-snow post

some of you might remember dinky , a ragdoll cat , which was supposed to have been loaded on to a plane to return to northamptonshire with owners ian and sue lees in july - but went missing at dubai airport .
after weeks of searching , he was found safe and well at a sanctuary near dubai and returned to northampton .

growing up in dubai , he is more used to temperatures up to 48c ( 118f ) had never seen snow , but although dinky was unsure at first , he does n't seem to mind it a bit .

documents.title: councils invest £ 90m in property
text: northamptonshire 's councils are bringing in almost £ 7m each year through a portfolio of external properties worth more than £ 90m , figures obtained by the bbc have revealed .
the eight local authorities have invested £ 30m in sites across the county in the last three years alone .
this includes £ 21m spent by corby borough council on an industrial unit in curver way , which brings a return of £ 1.6m a year to spend on local services .
labour mp meg hillier , chairman of the public accounts committee , said external investment was not without risk .
`` the question is , have they got the skills and understanding to do a good job ?
where is the oversight and how expert is that oversight ?
that 's a real challenge , both for local councils and government , '' she said .

documents.title: scrapping of greyfriars scheme 'an opportunity '
text: plans for a development featuring restaurants , a hotel and either a cinema or trampoline centre at northampton 's greyfriars site have been scrapped .

northampton borough council 's cabinet last night agreed a motion to `` part ways '' with carter endurance after the developer said it could n't deliver on promises for the housing element of the scheme .
the old `` brutalist '' concrete bus station was demolished in march 2015 and the site has been unused ever since .

conservative council leader jonathan nunn said he agreed with many opponents of the original scheme , adding he had concerns over traffic issues and `` a bit of risk we had n't bottomed-out adequately '' .
`` i think it is an opportunity , '' he added .
`` it is a chance for a re-think . ''
author: Craig Lewis

documents.title: watford toys r us store due to close in the spring
text: following tuesday 's news that toys r us is to shut 'at least ' 26 uk stores , the company has confirmed that the watford store will close .
the toy chain , which has 106 stores in the uk , said its closures would start in spring next year and that there would be `` no disruption for customers '' over christmas and new year .
in hertfordshire , the watford store in century park will close in spring 2018 if the proposals are accepted but stevenage will remain open .
the company said the intention is for the bedford , luton and milton keynes stores to remain open but the company is reviewing options including downsizing or a possible reduction in rent .
toys r us said online shopping would be unaffected by the plans and that there would be no changes to its returns policies or gift cards across the festive period .

documents.title: council to meet to discuss future of greyfriars site
text: the re-development of the greyfriars bus station site is set to be discussed by councillors at a meeting this evening .
the old brutalist bus station was demolished back in march 2015 .
developers carter endurance have since seen plans for restaurants , a hotel , a coach station and either a cinema or a trampoline centre at the site approved .
the proposals also featured student and retirement accommodation .
papers set to be discussed by northampton borough council tonight suggest carter endurance is unable to achieve its original offer and has submitted a revised application .
the cabinet papers recommend the council `` parts ways '' with carter endurance , giving it the chance to `` reconsider offers for the development of the whole site '' .
the developer has said the residential element of the proposal had proved difficult to finance , but has asked for more time to see if it can still deliver the project .
the greyfriars scheme is one of a number in northampton which are either behind-schedule or over-budget .
author: Craig Lewis
BBC Northampton Politics Reporter

documents.title: corby cube still not fully occupied
text: seven years after it opened , the corby cube is still not fully occupied .
the civic building cost an estimated £ 48m - £ 13m over budget - and contains council offices , a library and theatre .

two years ago , the top floor of the building was marketed as office space but there were no takers ; now the local borough council has now spent £ 180,000 converting the open-plan top floor into four offices .
`` we are aware of the difficulties we had with this building initially , '' said corby borough council leader tom beattie .
`` but i am very confident and very proud of this building . ''
`` it has really transformed the landscape here in the town centre .
we would have liked to have seen all four floors of the building in use sooner than we have done , but we are where we are . ''

the road will form a new 3.5 mile-long single carriageway to improve links between northampton and daventry , as well as improving access to the m1 .

text: a 17-year-old boy has been jailed for four-and-a-half years for stabbing a man in a `` nasty and sadistic attack '' in northampton .
victim dharmin desai , 30 , had been drinking in kettering and took a taxi to see a woman he knew in northampton one night in june .
it was there he met the defendant , who ca n't be named because of his age .
after an argument about a phone the next morning , mr desai was stabbed repeatedly in the chest with a kitchen knife .
at northampton crown court the defendant pleaded guilty to wounding with intent , grievous bodily harm and having a bladed article in a public place after earlier denying the offence .
the court heard the boy and victim shared the affections of the unmarried mother , with the attack being described as `` nasty and sadistic '' by judge rupert mayo .

documents.title: advent excitement returns to village
text: it 's that time of year when we can peep behind the first door of our advent calendars - or wait for the big reveal at a hairdressers , pub or supermarket .
now in its fifth year , the village of brigstock , near corby , has created a trail of festive window displays for each of the 24 days of advent .
businesses and residents take part - with people waiting in streets and front gardens for a glimpse of the seasonal scene .
the first display , by the knit and natter group , will be on show later at the old three cocks pub , with another unveiled at the co-op on saturday .
trail maps are available on facebook or each evening , for a small donation to the kettering and district riding for the disabled .

documents.title: council delays cuts announcement over funding settlement
text: northamptonshire county council has delayed a meeting at which details of more than £ 27m worth of savings were due to be announced .
the cabinet meeting has been put back a week to 19 december while the council awaits an announcement from government on its funding settlement .
the county council is currently consulting on almost £ 10m worth of cuts , with libraries and trading standards among services in the firing line .

text: four libraries and the winter road-gritting regime are among services at risk if a council has its funding reduced , it has claimed .

wellingborough 's full council is expected to express `` deep concern '' to northamptonshire county council that a savings target of £ 37.3m in the 2018-19 budget will have a `` severe negative impact on families '' .
councillors are meeting later and are expected to approve a letter calling for the councils to work together to help lessen the impact on residents .
it claims reductions may have to be made in highway maintenance , salt stocks , road gritting and bus subsidies , and that earls barton , finedon , irchester and wollaston libraries could close .

documents.title: work begins to clear grenade mound near weedon play area
text: work is beginning today to remove a mound at a village playing field near daventry where unexploded munitions were found in july 2016 .
the site at jubilee field in weedon was sealed off after the discovery of two grenades , which are thought to have come from weedon barracks .
the ministry of defence has agreed to pay for the removal of the hill and anything beneath its surface .
weedon parish council found the cost of clearing the site would be more than £ 1m .
two companies have been commissioned to carry out the work and will treat and remove any waste under the supervision of explosives experts .
the operation 's likely to finish at the end of february , but it 'll stay fenced off until grass grows .
author: Stuart Bailey
BBC News

text: two men have been charged in connection with cash machine attacks in the east midlands and neighbouring counties .
charlie smith , 31 , from mere lane in bitteswell , and alfie adams , 36 , from bickershaw lane in wigan , have both been charged with four counts of burglary and one count of theft .
the men have both been remanded in custody to appear at leicester magistrates ' court today .

text: police in northampton have been given additional powers after a shooting last friday evening .
two women in a car were shot at in south holme court , thorplands , and suffered minor injuries .
officers are allowed to `` exclude '' people from the area if they believe anti-social behaviour or crime is likely to occur .
the powers will initially be in force for 48 hours until 18:00 on saturday .
a 22-year-old man arrested in connection with the incident has since been released under investigation .

the festive rush begins today with so-called black friday , an annual discount sales event that started in the united states and many shops in the uk now take part in .

both suffered minor injuries and required hospital treatment .

documents.title: northampton leader gives views on rail freight plans
text: yesterday , we reported that northampton borough council had decided plans for a rail freight interchange would make a `` valuable contribution towards the economic growth of northampton '' .

jonathan nunn , leader of the council , said : `` as one of the consultees on this application , we will continue to work with the developers to produce a statement of common ground and a local impact report , as required by legislation .
`` these will then be submitted to the planning inspectorate , who are the determining authority .
`` we are aware of the strong feelings about this application around air quality , traffic and noise , which will form part of the council 's assessment in the local impact report .
`` but residents really should engage directly with the developers as required by the national infrastructure project process . ''
author: Nic Rigby
BBC News

documents.title: northampton rail freight plan gets support of council
text: councillors have given their backing to a multimillion-pound rail freight interchange , which the developers say could create 7,500 jobs .
councillors backed a report which said the plans would make a `` valuable contribution towards the economic growth of northampton '' .
roxhill developers want to build the depot and warehousing on a 116 acre ( 468,000 sq m ) site at junction 15 of the m1 , south of northampton .
the site would also include container storage , lorry parking and rail sidings to serve each warehouse .
northampton borough council 's planning committee has agreed to back the plans .

the northampton gateway strategic rail freight interchange scheme will also be examined by south northamptonshire council on 30 november , before it is submitted to the planning inspectorate early next year .
author: Nic Rigby
BBC News

documents.title: two arrested after 'slavery ' raids
text: seven people have been taken to a salvation army reception centre following a number of raids at nail bars in bedford , luton and kettering .
police say they are trying to `` establish whether they have been subjected to any trafficking or modern day slavery offences '' .
searches were carried out at properties on wyatt road , kempston ; midland road , bedford ; george street , luton ; and silver street in kettering .
a 40-year-old man and a 19-year-old woman have been arrested for suspected money laundering and remain in custody .

documents.title: school children protest in support of at-risk library
text: about 60 primary school children gathered in desborough earlier to show their support for the town 's library , which could be closed .
children as young as four from havelock infant and junior schools and loatlands primary held heart-shaped balloons , placards and banners and shouted `` we love our library '' .
it was organised by pauline holmes , who is leading the campaign to save the facility .
she said : `` it 's an important community hub .
`` it 's our heart and without it we would n't be the same . ''
northamptonshire county council announced last month that some libraries could be community-run while some smaller ones could close as part of proposals to make £ 10m of cuts .
a council spokesman said : `` due to the authority 's significant funding pressures , we have no option but to consult on a proposed review of the current model for northamptonshire libraries .
`` the proposals have been drawn up to take into account geographical location , deprivation indicators , patterns of usage , book borrowing and visitor numbers . ''
a consultation on the future of the county 's libraries runs until 13 january and a decision will be made on 22 february .
author: Stuart Bailey
BBC News

documents.title: east midlands ' house prices 'to out perform ' london
text: house prices in the east midlands are expected to out perform london over the next five years , according to estate agents savills .
the estate agent claims that between now and 2022 the average uk house price growth could slow to just over 14 % .
however , the east midlands ' market is expected to strengthen and overtake that rate at 14.8 % .
savills said this is significant because it is more than double the rate at which house prices are expected to increase in london - which is forecast at around 7 % .
author: Samantha Fisher
BBC News Online

documents.title: plans for new health centre and homes in byfield
text: plans have been put forward for a new doctor 's surgery and 90 homes in a village near daventry .
byfield medical centre has applied to daventry district council to build on the greenfield site off woodford road , byfield ,
the plans have divided the village with the parish council expressing concerns about how the scheme could increase traffic in and around byfield .

dr adam bone , a senior doctor with the medical practice ( below ) - which serves 8,000 patients - said a new centre ( above , artist 's impression ) was needed as the present building was `` about a third of the size it should be '' .
john gillick , chairman of byfield parish council , said the parish council wanted a plan that suited the `` entire community '' and addressed `` traffic concerns , which are a real issue '' .
author: Nic Rigby
BBC News

documents.title: retirement hope for toothless 'drooly ' cat
text: this is jonesey , an elderly ginger tom who is `` a bit drooly '' and has almost no teeth , and was brought into the rspca 's northamptonshire branch in june by his owner , who said he could not afford to treat his pet 's infected mouth and `` constant drooling '' .

the `` ravenous and very thin '' 14-year-old was signed over to the charity whose vets put him on antibiotics and painkillers and carried out `` major '' dental surgery , leaving jonesey with just four good teeth .

jonesey has severe gingivitis ( inflamed gums ) and stomatitis ( mouth inflammation ) and will need ongoing steroids and antibiotics but the rspca says if jonesey is homed locally , the branch will cover the cost of its own vets treating his conditions .
adoptions manager emma markham hopes a new owner or foster carer will come forward so that jonesey `` can live out his years in a nice , quiet home and enjoy his retirement '' .
`` he is 14 years young and is a bit drooly at the moment as he has just had all his teeth taken out , but he 's an extremely friendly and cuddly cat , '' she added .

text: a section of the a5 through northamptonshire has reopened after a suspected world war two explosive device was discovered this morning .
emergency services were called to church stowe , near daventry , at about 09:15 following the find by contractors carrying out roadworks in the area .
the road was closed between furnace lane and heyford lane while an raf explosive ordnance disposal team attended the scene .
it is estimated that some 30,000 tonnes of bombs it is estimated that some 30,000 tonnes of bombs were dropped on britain during ww2 bombing raids .

documents.title: a5 closed after suspected ww2 explosive found
text: northamptonshire police says the a5 is closed following the discovery of a suspected world war two explosive device .
emergency services were called to church stowe , near daventry , at about 09:15 this morning following the discovery of the device by contractors carrying out roadworks in the area .
officers say a cordon has been put in place while emergency services await the arrival of the raf explosive ordnance disposal team .
the a5 is currently closed in both directions between the junctions of furnace lane and heyford lane and motorists are advised to find an alternative route .

documents.title: rushden chicken farm plans `` are simply abhorrent '' , mp says
text: the government is being urged to intervene to stop a broiler chicken farm being built in northamptonshire .
plans have been submitted by bedfordia farms for 10 poultry buildings in rushden , with each containing more than 50,000 birds .
almost 7,000 people have signed a petition opposing the plans .
`` these conditions are simply abhorrent , '' peter bone , the conservative mp for wellingborough , told the commons .
`` it is no way to treat thinking , feeling creatures .
to me , it feels completely un-british . ''
farming minister george eustice said the government could n't interfere in the planning process , but any development would have to abide by strict standards .
east northamptonshire council 's planning management committee is due to look at granting approval for the project on 13 december .

documents.title: young musicians prepare for royal albert hall concert
text: about 700 young northamptonshire musicians are getting ready to appear on stage at the royal albert hall in london .
they 'll perform a 12-minute piece tonight , called `` nene '' , which was written by composer benjamin till ( below ) from higham ferrers .
you may remember last year we covered his 122-mile walk along the entire length of the river nene , which he did to gain inspiration .
he said : `` it was a lot to do with sound , the sound of the water and the sound of the birds - red kites were quite prevalent - and that found its way into the composition .
`` but it was a challenge .
my toenail fell off and i ended up in a & e when i fell off a fence . ''
it 's been organised by the northamptonshire music and performing arts trust , in conjunction with local schools .
singer freya leverett said : `` i 'm lucky enough to be singing a solo about a girl called molly who gets drowned in the river nene .
`` i think the sound of the singers is incredible and to add the youth orchestra and the brass band , it 's just going to be such an amazing opportunity to sing with this many people . ''
happy # nene day .
we look forward to seeing all the performers today .

documents.title: halloween 'magic ' for 'dracula bat-cat '
text: halloween worked its magic for a homeless cat which has been likened to count dracula by a charity .

seven-year-old raphael not only has a gnarly gnasher , but also a `` deformed ear '' that makes him look `` just like a bat '' , the rspca said , when it issued a plea for a new home for him at the end of october .
he was nicknamed `` count catula '' by staff at the charity 's northamptonshire branch .
they were hoping his `` unusual '' looks would not put off a potential new owner , and sure enough someone fell in love with the little `` bat-cat '' .
raphael is now settling into his new home with a woman in northampton , who him up on saturday .
halloween was definitely lucky for this black cat .

the alleged offender was an asian man in his 30s , of medium build , with short dark hair and beard .
a man has been arrested in connection with this incident and released under investigation .

documents.title: watford pet rabbit death 'linked to croydon cat killer '
text: an animal charity helping police investigate the violent killing of hundreds of cats and rabbits across the uk has said the death of a rabbit in watford is being linked to the case .
the animal was mutilated and its body left in a garden in silver dell on monday or tuesday .
hertfordshire police said its possible link to the wider investigation is a line of enquiry .

tony jenkins from charity snarl said : `` it is clear these animals were killed by a human '' but added it was difficult to say how many people were responsible for the attacks and whether they were working together .
other recent incidents considered to be linked include the deaths of a cat and another rabbit in hertfordshire as well as two cats in northampton .
author: Stuart Bailey
BBC News

documents.title: breakingmissing scarborough teenagers could be in london
text: a missing teenage girl from scarborough is with a 15-year-old boy and they could be in london police say .
annabelle addison , 15 , is missing with 15-year-old michael moore , they have n't been seen since 4 november and do n't have any money available to them .
officers say they left scarborough by train and they are currently in the cambridge or london areas but they also have links in leicester , northampton , the west midlands , merseyside and norfolk .
north yorkshire police say that anyone with any possible sightings of annabelle and michael should `` get in touch without delay '' .

documents.title: decision delayed on 'bite dog ' muppet 's future
text: a decision on whether a dog will be destroyed for biting four people after it escaped from a garden during storm doris has been delayed until the new year .
northamptonshire police applied for a civil destruction order for muppet - seized from ingleborough way , duston , northampton , on 23 february .
the force announced the move on its facebook page and has had 420 comments to date , most attacking the decision .
the dog 's owner refused to sign a destruction order and a hearing due at wellingborough magistrates ' court on 10 october was adjourned .
a northamptonshire police spokeswoman said : `` we have n't been given a date for the next hearing but believe it could be in january or early next year . ''
author: Stuart Bailey
BBC News

documents.title: rushden lakes congestion to be discussed
text: a meeting will be held later to discuss traffic problems around rushden lakes .
cars arriving at the shopping centre often have to queue to get off the a45 at peak times .
developers lxb announced plans on wednesday for a new access road .
waitrose is hosting today 's forum , which will involve representatives from highways england , lxb , stagecoach buses and local councillors .
they 'll be talking about how traffic flows can be improved and how the impact of nearby roadworks can be reduced .

text: detectives in corby are investigating a sexual assault on a 13-year-old girl .
officers say she was assaulted on saturday between 09:30 and 23:00 in fawcett way between the corby international pool and the boating lake .
three men , aged 49 , 26 and 25 , have been arrested and released under investigation .
any witnesses or anyone with information is being asked to contact the police .

documents.title: northamptonshire recruits south african social workers
text: northamptonshire county council is to recruit social workers from south africa as part of proposals to save almost £ 10m .
the authority is currently consulting on a range of proposed cuts to services , including libraries , and bus subsidies .
a report going before councillors on monday says the authority aims to employ 10 full time social workers from south africa from april 2018 .
the move would save £ 310,000 by cutting the use of agency staff .

BBC News

documents.title: wellingborough homes see huge price hikes
text: average house prices in wellingborough have seen a larger increase in the past year than anywhere else in the country , according to new figures from the land registry .
prices in the town rose by 15 % in the year to august .
the average national increase is 5 % .

documents.title: corby voted 'best town '
text: corby has been voted the best town in uk and ireland at the 2018 urbanism awards , as reported in the northamptonshire telegraph .
the town fought off competition from fellow finalists coventry and milton keynes .

david rudlin , chair of the academy , said : `` corby has achieved what many towns in the wider ripples of the 'london effect ' hope to - a desirable , affordable , well-connected place to live and bring up a family , whether you are a commuter into london or working locally in one of the town 's many new businesses . ''
author: Northamptonshire Telegraph

documents.title: council could cut corby children 's centres
text: funding for children 's centres in corby could be cut as part of northamptonshire county council proposals to save millions of pounds .
the council is currently consulting on plans which would see more than £ 500,000 of cuts to the service .
the proposals are part of £ 9.6m-worth of planned savings proposed by the authority , with services such as libraries , buses and road maintenance under threat .
the authority is also set to reveal details of a further £ 27m of planned cuts in december .
in corby , children 's centres will be subject to a review of what they provide and their locations , with funding for support services and children 's centre services under threat .
in all , the cuts would see a 40 % reduction in the children 's services contract in corby .
author: Craig Lewis
BBC Northampton Politics Reporter

documents.title: northampton hospital rated 'good ' by cqc
text: northampton general hospital has been praised for the improvements it has made by a health watchdog .
the care quality commission ( cqc ) rated the hospital `` good '' following inspections in july and august .
a 2014 report rated it as `` requiring improvement '' .

cqc 's chief inspector of hospitals , prof ted baker , said `` a number of improvements had been made '' , including around the hospital 's leadership , which was described as `` approachable , cohesive , and inclusive '' .
he said staff were also `` friendly , professional , compassionate and helpful towards patients '' .
many of those patients also spoke positively about the workers , he added .
however , there were some areas where the trust needed to make improvements .
the hospital was told to review and monitor discharges delayed for more than eight hours in critical care .
author: Nic Rigby
BBC News

documents.title: north yorkshire teenager 's disappearance sparks appeal
text: police are appealing for help in tracing a missing 15-year-old girl from north yorkshire .
annabelle addison , from scarborough , has n't been since since about 21:00 on saturday night .
police believe she does n't have any money or a phone and think she may have left with a boy on a train .
it 's thought she has links with the leicester , northampton , west midlands and merseyside areas .
she 's described as white , of slim build , fair skinned , with very dark long straight hair which is usually scrunched up .

annabelle speaks with a southern accent and when she was last seen she was wearing a blue jumper and a black jumper , pink mini mouse pyjama bottoms with grey jogging bottoms over the top , a black superdry jacket and black and white adidas trainers .
